basics.name: Katrina H. Turner
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a M.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2021.

work.company: UH Manoa- Laboratory for Advanced Visualization and Applications (LAVA)
highlights: Current Project: NetSage (creating visualizations for Internet2 network flow data)

work.summary: Teaching assistant for undergraduate ICS courses
highlights: Fall 2018: (141-Discrete Math) Run weekly recitations for students, hold office hours, grader
Spring 2019: (311-Algorithms) Assist students with class problems during lecture, office hours, grader

work.summary: Waialua High & Intermediate, Castle High School
highlights: Subjects taught: Math 7, Algebra I, Modeling our World, Geometry, Algebra II, AP Statistics
Attended EdTechTeam GAFE Summit as Google Rep for school.
Taught Professional Development classes for teachers on Google Apps.
Attended training to incorporate programming into curriculum through Altino cars.
Technology pillar for school accreditation process.

volunteer.summary: Help organize and run OIA wrestling tournaments
highlights: 2014-2018: Administrative Coach at Castle High School.
Organize and run season and championship tournaments.

awards.title: UH Regent Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships are awarded to 20 outstanding freshmen who receive an SAT total score of at least 1340 or ACT combined score of at least 29, maintain at least a 3.5 GPA in academic subjects in high school, and whose extracurricular achievements are shown to be remarkable.
